definition: with a sudden shock, bang etc
to feel a rush of excitement (idiom)

sentences.english: All art, like all love, is rooted in heartache.
sentences.chinese: 藝術就像愛情，源於怦然心動。

sentences.english: Inside was the still-beating heart of Davy Jones.
sentences.chinese: 裏面裝着戴維瓊斯那顆怦然跳動的心臟。

sentences.english: Almost all the beautiful things people can be most exciting, heart health pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 大凡美麗的事物，均可讓人怦然心動，心生愉悅。

sentences.english: Your name is ordinary but it effects my mood all round.
sentences.chinese: 你的名字雖然如此平凡，卻總是讓我怦然心動。

sentences.english: When she occasionally read the announcement 20 years ago, her heart kept thumping.
sentences.chinese: 當她20年前偶然看到那則啓事後，便怦然心動。

sentences.english: In your life, how many moments, you would a person palpitating with excitement eager to do sth…
sentences.chinese: 人的一生中，有多少個瞬間，你會對一個人怦然心動。

sentences.english: I will still be excited when you knock on my door.
sentences.chinese: 我依然會爲你的敲門聲怦然心動。

sentences.english: Heard that, my heart begin with thump-thump and gradually fell into meditation.
sentences.chinese: 我聽了，怦然有所動，漸漸地墜入沉思。

definition: to feel a rush of excitement (idiom)
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
thumping sound (onom.)/to be eager and anxious (to do sth)/faithful and upright
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
the affection, or heart, of a young woman
heart (as the seat of emotions)/cardiac atrium
